item.title: Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.Abstractions: Now Available

item.title: Introducing Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData Preview
item.description: We are excited to introduce the Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.Abstractions package available in preview today. This new package provides a unified abstraction layer that enables you to integrate vector stores into your .NET applications. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/introducing-microsoft-extensions-vector-data

item.title: Announcing Technical Preview of the GitHub Copilot upgrade assistant for Java
item.description: As AI and LLMs continue to evolve, agentic workflows are rapidly emerging as the next wave of AI-assistance. Agentic workflows allow AI systems to coordinate tasks and make decisions with minimal human input. These systems use autonomous agents in their workflow and can bring enormous benefits as they can create plans, perform individual tasks, employ [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/technical-preview-github-copilot-upgrade-assistant-for-java

item.title: Create Unreal Engine modules faster
item.description: Unreal Engine modules help keep your code organized and modular. However, creating modules can be a tedious and error-prone process that involves manually editing configuration files and adding boilerplate code. Visual Studio 2022 version 17.11 comes with a new dialog to help with this process. With the new Add Module dialog, you can quickly add [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/create-unreal-engine-modules-faster

item.title: No new Azure DevOps OAuth apps beginning February 2025
item.description: Starting February 3, 2025, we will no longer accept new registrations of Azure DevOps OAuth apps. This is the first step we‚Äôll be taking towards our longer-term vision of sunsetting the Azure DevOps OAuth platform. Moving forward, we‚Äôll be publicly advocating all developers that are building applications on top of Azure DevOps REST APIs to [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/no-new-azure-devops-oauth-apps-beginning-february-2025

item.title: Automate Power Platform Environment Creation & Solution Imports with GitHub Actions (Federated Auth Setup)
item.description: Automate Power Platform Environment Creation & Solution Imports with GitHub Actions (Federated Auth Setup) Automating your CI/CD pipeline for Power Platform solutions streamlines development and reduces manual tasks. Integrating GitHub Actions with federated authentication provides secure and scalable access for creating environments, importing solutions, and even cleaning up temporary environments. item.title: Diving into Function Calling and its JSON Schema in Semantic Kernel .NET
item.description: Diving into Function Calling and its JSON Schema in Semantic Kernel .NET Function-calling¬†is one of the most exciting features of certain Large Language Models (LLMs), enabling developers to execute code directly in response to user queries. In Semantic Kernel, we streamline the process by allowing you to use built-in plugins or integrate your own code [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/diving-into-function-calling-and-its-json-schema-in-semantic-kernel-net

item.title: Easily add Unreal Engine classes to your C++ project
item.description: Visual Studio 2022 v17.11 introduces a new Add Unreal Engine Class dialog that lets you easily add common Unreal Engine classes to your project. You can also choose to which module to add your class, so you can keep your code organized and modular. To use this feature, you need to have an Unreal Engine [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/easily-add-unreal-engine-classes-to-your-c-project

item.title: How to correctly use access tokens and ID tokens in your client application
item.description: Explore the differences between access tokens and ID tokens and how to use them securely in your applications. This blog post explains why access tokens should be treated as opaque by client apps, and offers best practices for secure token handling. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/identity/access-tokens-and-id-tokens

item.title: Java OpenJDK October 2024 Patch & Security Updates
item.description: Hello Java customers! We are happy to announce the latest October 2024 patch & security update release for the Microsoft Build of OpenJDK. Download and install the binaries today. The source code of our builds is available now [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/java-openjdk-oct-2024-patch-security-updates
